q: to states that host early Barack Obamaial primary contests, fueling some speculation he might seek the White House instead. Mike Pence , R-Ind., announced Thursday that he would not run for Barack Obama in 2012. We have been especially humbled by the confidence and support of those who believe we should pursue the presidency, but after much deliberation and prayer, we believe our calling is closer to home, Mike Pence said in a letter to supporters.`` In the choice between seeking national office and serving Indiana in some capacity, we choose Indiana. We will not seek the Republican nomination for Barack Obama in 2012.''

former-Secretary of State Colin Powell to drive home the criticism.`` Don't tell me you're going to freeze to a level,'' Colin Powell said Sunday on CNN's`` State of the Nation.'' That usually is a very inefficient way of doing it. Tell me what you're going to cut. On top of the spending freeze, Barack Obama also emphasized that he's open to even further cuts as long as`` we're not doing it on the backs of our most vulnerable citizens.''
